ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yeah! It is very important to all of us.
sure. this class is a must for any phd student.
You have to take it, but don't dread that -- it's actually quite interesting.

I recommend taking this course. It gives people an opportunity to think about the ethical conduct which is quite important as a scientist. All of the students were involved in the discussion, and the atmosphere of the class was quite good.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It made me understand it much better.
this helps so much. it's a must-know for a phd student.
Overall great idea for allowing students to voice their opinions about our ethical responsibilities as scientists in society.
Much more useful than the Graduate School's ethics course during orientation. I deal with these questions in my research frequently, and it was nice to see them in a broader context.
